SEARCH
Module com.example.cybooks
Package com.example.cybooks.models

Class Loan

java.lang.Object
com.example.cybooks.models.Loan
public class Loan extends Object
The Loan class represents a book loan in the CyBooks application. It contains details about the loan such as the loan ID, user ID, book title, author, editor, loan date, and return date.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors

    Description

    Constructs a new Loan with the specified details including loan ID.
    Loan(int userId, String title, String author, String editor)
    Constructs a new Loan with the specified details without loan ID.

  • Constructor Details

    • Loan

      public Loan(int idloan, int userId, String title, String author, String editor, LocalDate loanDate, LocalDate returnDate)
      Constructs a new Loan with the specified details including loan ID.
      Parameters:
      idloan - the ID of the loan
      userId - the ID of the user
      title - the title of the book
      author - the author of the book
      editor - the editor of the book
      loanDate - the date when the loan was made
      returnDate - the date when the loan should be returned

    • Loan

      public Loan(int userId, String title, String author, String editor)
      Constructs a new Loan with the specified details without loan ID. The loan date is set to the current date and the return date is calculated based on the loan duration.
      Parameters:
      userId - the ID of the user
      title - the title of the book
      author - the author of the book
      editor - the editor of the book

      public void deleteLoan(Connection conn) throws SQLException
      Deletes this loan from the database.
      Parameters:
      conn - the database connection
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs

    • addLoan

      public static boolean addLoan(Connection conn, Loan newLoan) throws Exception
      Adds a new loan to the database.
      Parameters:
      conn - the database connection
      newLoan - the new loan to be added
      Returns:
      true if the loan was added successfully, false otherwise
      Throws:
      Exception - if the maximum number of loans per user is exceeded

    • getTopLoansInLast30Days

      public static List<LoanStats> getTopLoansInLast30Days(Connection conn) throws SQLException
      Gets the top 5 most borrowed books in the last 30 days.
      Parameters:
      conn - the database connection
      Returns:
      a list of LoanStats objects representing the top borrowed books
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs

      Throws:
